meanings.definition: The act of reviving someone from unconsciousness or apparent death.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, the doctor performed reanimation on the injured man.
meanings.sent2: The reanimation of the patient was successful, and he woke up in the hospital.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor pretended to do reanimation on the sleeping princess.
meanings.sent4: The reanimation of the old computer breathed new life into its functions.
meanings.sent5: The reanimation scene in the movie was so realistic, it gave me chills.

meanings.definition: The process of bringing something back to life or restoring vitality.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are studying the reanimation of ancient plants from fossils.
meanings.sent2: The reanimation of the garden after winter brought color back to the yard.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret sauce was like a reanimation elixir for the bland dish.
meanings.sent4: The reanimation of the town's economy breathed new energy into the community.
meanings.sent5: The reanimation of the old building turned it into a vibrant cultural center.
